Counter Strike : Global Offensive is free to play (with limitations)- If you choose to play CS without upgrading your account, you can still play all of the game modes. It is actually pretty good for a free game. You cannot receive drops or a rank however. Steam cards are also not available to free accounts

Pros ->

1) 
Good multiplayer game- CS can be played with teams of 5 friends if you queue up in competitive mode. Cs also has the largest player base of any game on steam, so there are always people to play with.

2)
Game is updated regularly- CS receives updates on the regular, and operations are added yearly (as of the date of this review)

3)
Number of hackers lessened- In my experience, the number of hackers in this game has been greatly reduced over the years. I am playing on a new free to play account (an alt) to test this, and it does seem to hold up.

Cons - 
1) You won't be able to sustain your relations after you get addicted to this game p.s.
it will permenantly damage your brain and you willl be autistic

Classic FPS Game. However, full of cheaters ie. wallers, aimbots, etc. The game is quite active and new operations gives people a reason to come and play back CSGO. If Valve can have a better anti-cheat system in the game, everyone would play this no doubt. Community is not that toxic unless you play with high rank players in competitive. A shooting game where you can't aim because the bullets go anywhere but through the crosshair. Skating makes it impossible to move and stop effectively. Gameplay consists of being funneled down one of two corridors towards opponents pixel peaking you with one bodyshot kill rifles. It's amazing anyone actually plays this.
